text:
Sawaddee ka! welcome to hot thai kitchen so if you 
love chilies this recipe is for you i am making a

fried rice using not one not two but three types 
of chili so it is a triple chili fried rice

and you're gonna see how the different types 
of chilies come together to create a beautiful

symphony of flavors i also got lots of tricks 
for the perfect fried rice coming as well

let's get started perfect fried rice trick number 
one always marinate your protein there is nothing

worse than a delicious plate of fried rice 
interrupted by bland dry boneless skinless

chicken breasts we've all been there right so i'm 
using boneless skinless chicken breast today just

to demonstrate to you that this can be delicious 
and i'm gonna marinate very simply with soy sauce

and also a little bit of sugar will 
help flavor and it'll also help

browning a little bit of water and this water 
is going to get absorbed into the chicken along

with the seasoning almost like a brine and that's 
going to help prevent it from drying out and keep

the chicken juicy and tender trust me this makes 
all the difference so you want to do this first

before you do anything and it just needs 
about 15 minutes perfect fried rice trick

number two a lot of people will tell you 
that you need to use day-old cold rice for

the perfect fried rice you don't need to do 
that i've never worked in a single restaurant

that has cold rice in the fridge for your fried 
rice but if you're using rice straight from the

rice cooker what you can do is just spread it out 
onto a plate and really allow the excess steam to

escape let the rice cool down and then when you go 
to cook it the grains will come apart more easily

if you're cooking rice specifically for fried 
rice i also recommend adding a little less water

than you normally would okay so that's rice 
and of course for thai food you always want to

use jasmine rice now the sauce introducing chili 
number one the most important chili of this recipe

thai chili paste now this recipe the thai name 
is kao pad nam prik pao, and nam prik pao is

this guy it's a sweet rich umami paste it's 
a really unique flavor no good substitute

other than to make it yourself which i have a 
recipe for i'll link to it below but to nip that

question in the butt no you can't substitute it 
with anything and all you need from this recipe

is just about a tablespoon and a little there's 
quite a bit of oil on top i'm going to just add

some of that just for extra flavor and color you 
don't absolutely need to now that sauce is very

thick so i'm gonna pre-mix it with our fish 
sauce because if you just throw a tablespoon

of chili paste and you'll have a heck of a time 
trying to get it mixed into the rice okay so

that is what you're looking for and believe 
it or not that is all there is to the sauce

the chili paste is doing most of the heavy lifting 
here which is why you really can't go without it

all right time to cook before we move on we need 
to talk about something very important and that

is your well-being if you've ever felt stressed 
depressed anxious or overwhelmed like i often do i

highly recommend you check out our sponsor today 
betterhelp when i had my son a few years ago i

really struggled i was overwhelmed by the demands 
of being a new parent while maintaining my work

and personal relationships it was very hard and 
i wish i had known about better health back then

betterhelp offers experienced licensed therapists 
who are trained to listen and help you and you

don't have to go to an office which i know 
for many that's an obstacle you can talk

to your therapist in a private online environment 
wherever you are whenever it's convenient for you

betterhelp has over 20 000 therapists with a 
broad range of expertise so you can access help

that may not even be available where you live how 
it works is you fill out a questionnaire to help

assess your needs and within 48 hours you're 
going to be matched with a therapist then you

schedule a secure phone or video sessions with 
them and the best part is you can also exchange

unlimited text messages and everything you share 
is completely confidential now if you would like

a new therapist you can request one anytime at no 
additional charge so i was matched with shawna a

therapist with decades of experience and her 
approach is to teach you techniques to help

identify faulty thinking patterns that are not 
serving you so that you can move towards a more

joyful life so if you want to take charge of your 
mental health and join over two million people

who've done the same thing check out betterhelp 
and you can get 10 of your first month by going to

betterhelp.com/pailin's kitchen 
alright wok on in goes some oil and now

the chicken which as you can see most of the water 
has already gone inside the chicken so you don't

see much pooling anymore you spread the chicken 
out best you can and then you don't disturb it for

a solid you know 30 seconds to a minute just to 
get that browning on the chicken because browning

is flavor that's why boiled chicken doesn't taste 
as good as grilled chicken see that that is what

we're going for so oh no the other pieces need a 
bit of time there we go you want pieces like that

and then you can just give it a toss and 
now you're just wanting to get them cooked

okay that's pretty much done i'm gonna 
turn it off and remove the chicken

i mean this chicken alone is already tasty 
and you can put this chicken in any kind

of stir-fries fried rice fried noodles 
so all my all-purpose chicken marinade

next i'm going to scramble the eggs in 
the same wok my eggs are gonna go in

and i'm just gonna scramble them 
until they are completely done

scraping out any stuffed chicken 
bits because that's good flavor

and then as soon as it's done i'm taking it also 
out of the pan now i can go in with the chicken

i don't always do this meaning i don't always 
scramble the eggs and take it out but for this

particular recipe if you put the sauce on the 
eggs the eggs kind of turn the same color as

the rice and then it's not as pretty and so this 
way the eggs also remain nice and tender i'm gonna

take a little break here to scrape off all the 
stuck bit and remind myself to re-season my wok

all right my wok is mostly clean medium heat 
and just a little bit of oil this time because

we already had oil in the chicken and the eggs 
i just need enough to saute my garlic and also

our chili number two dried roasted chili flakes so 
you can just use chili flakes from the store but i

roasted dried chilies to get it nice and smoky and 
then ground it in a coffee grinder and the reason

i add this is for heat because our thai chili 
paste is very mild like it's not spicy at all

so this is where the heat is coming from and also 
a little bit of smokiness is gonna come from the

chili flakes we're gonna just keep sauteing it 
until i can smell that smokiness in the air so

roast the chili is a little bit further maybe 
just a touch more that is smelling good can't

tell the garlic is golden because it's red now 
but you can kind of smell it so in goes the rice

get this rice a quick toss and 
pour the sauce directly on the rice

and it will help the rice split apart 
onions for a little bit of crunch

and then at this point i'm just working on 
making sure all the rice clumps are taken care of

press them down with a spatula tricks for 
perfect fried rice number three let it toast

listen to the sound of toasting rice 
get that brown flavor but don't burn it

so you know don't go overboard with this rice 
it's a little harder to tell because it's red

but that's toasting rice just want 
to give you that extra flavor okay

now the chicken and the egg goes in i do have a 
lot of chicken juice cooling here i'm gonna add it

all in because i know that my rice is dry enough 
that it can handle that extra chicken juice if

your rice for whatever reason is already looking 
like it's too wet you may want to not add it which

is a shame because that's really good flavor now 
our final chili the third chilies i'm going to add

is fresh chilies i've got fresnos and serranos but 
at this point you can do any kind of fresh chilies

that you're okay with the heat level and the 
reason fresh chilies are added is because they are

really different from the dried chilies with 
a you which is what's used in the chili paste

it adds a note of juiciness grassiness 
fruitiness freshness in general that's it

i'm going to turn this off and our final thing is 
thai basil but you know what if you can't find it

triple chilies all right if you can't find it this 
fried rice is delicious even without the basil

so don't stress over it if you feel like the 
third chilies are too much you can even just

do bell pepper it'll still give you that pop-up 
fruitiness without any extra heat and that's it

so good so delicious let's try it so right about 
now was when the front camera crapped out so

you're gonna have to stare at this beautiful 
plate while i tell you about the final touches

first a wedge of lime this is not a garnish the 
acidity of the lime is going to cut through the

richness and make all the difference some cucumber 
slices is a standard fried rice accompaniment in

thailand it'll add some crunchy freshness and 
it cleanses your palate as you go and that's

my triple chili fried rice seriously try it you 
will not be disappointed it's loaded with flavor

it's slightly sweet and just the right level of 
spicy and you can make this as spicy as you want

i'd like to thank all of our patreon 
members who helped support the show

if you want to join our community of 
thai food lovers check out the link below

thank you as always for watching 
and i'll see you next time
